meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or dismay.
meanings.sent3: Oop! I almost dropped my book.
meanings.sent4: Oop! The unexpected news hit me hard.
meanings.sent5: Oop! The sudden noise made me jump.

meanings.sent1: Making an oop in the calculation cost me the game.
meanings.sent2: She made an oop in her speech and had to correct herself.
meanings.sent3: The chef's oop turned the dish into a disaster.
meanings.sent4: His oop was like a stumble in a dance performance.
meanings.sent5: The student's oop was visible to everyone in the class.

meanings.definition: A quick, sharp movement or sound.
meanings.sent1: The oop of the door closing echoed in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: He made a sudden oop to catch the falling glass.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful oop knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The oop of the whip startled the horse into action.
meanings.sent5: The oop of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
